title: (x) Asta Gröting 'The Inner Voice' book cover - custom(ised) type, similar to Poplar {Tiff, Zachary O}
content:
Any ideas?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203103im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/DSCF6294_5943.jpg)

 [‹ Discovery Channel Magazine Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203103/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50266 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please what is this type? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203103/http:/www.typophile.com/node/50305 "Go to next forum topic")
author: lapvance

comments.content: Reminds me of a manipulated Poplar.
I think so too. Somebody had some fun with Poplar, either the designer of the book cover or some guy who then uploaded this as a freeware/shareware font.
The age and origin of the sample might help.

Hey vance!

.. it’s from a book designed by [Manuel Raeder  
](http://web.archive.org/web/20081009203103/http:/www.manuelraeder.co.uk/asta/asta01.html)

according to the site: “Book design for Asta Gröting, including the ’Inner Voice’ font.” .. and then “The ’Inner Voice’ font is based on classic theater poster fonts but with the task in mind, that it has been swallowed by one of the puppets and got stuck inside their throat.”

so I’m guessing it’s custom

Zohlman!

You always come through — thanks for the heads up!
